Stefano Lanza

Research Assistant in Theoretical Physics and Machine Learning

Welcome to my website!

I am Stefano Lanza, a Theoretical Physicist working in forefront research of String Theory and Quantum Gravity. In my daily research, I employ advanced tools from Machine Learning and Advanced Mathematics in order to uncover some of the most compelling mysteries of our Universe.

After having worked at Harvard University and at Utrecht University, I am currently employed as Research Assistant at the II. Institut f√ºr Theoretische Physik of the University of Hamburg. I work within the research groups of Prof. Timo Weigand and Prof. Alexander Westphal.

My Research, in brief

My research activities follow two main, complementary directions:

  1. Machine Learning String Theory
  2. Finding Quantum Gravity traces in our Universe

Previously, mostly during my Ph.D., my research has revolved around the following topic:

  • New supersymmetric theories, to better explain the Physics of our Universe
